page.title: 20YARWELL DISUSED QUARRY
page.content: Yarwell quarry occupies land which was formerly used for arable farming and is situated near Old Sulehay Forest. The quarry was opened in 1938 to provide limestone for the building of airfield runways and roads and by 1983 the stone was worked out and the quarry closed. There are two proposals for the future use of the land: The first is that the land should be used for a motocross circuit but this is opposed by local residents on grounds of noise, dust and increasd traffic on local roads. The other proposal which is supported by residents is that the quarry should become a nature reserve in conjunction with the adjoining woodland which is already protected by a preservation order.
